stories.text:
I have a slight dilemma, I am a CS graduate with no experience in real software development jobs. I can't get a job for two main reasons:

1) There are NO local jobs (I live in a shitty developing country). 2) Can't relocate to a different country due to financial issues. Aka, I don't have that much money.

What I am trying to do is get internships or preferably a remote junior position with only my CS degree.

Is this possible? Could you guide me?
stories.title: Ask HN: Are Remote Internships/Junior Positions Easy to Find?
Rodney Brooks Explains What Robust.ai Is Doing
Free websites so valuable they feel illegal
Electra Meccanica Solo Electric Commuter Vehicle

stories.text:
I recently exited a company and as part of the acquisition plan I also landed a job at the company. I am on IC track with an option/plan to switching to Director level if needed.

I was a technical founder and, as most founders do, I coded a lot in my startup life. I do miss that part but I am also looking at the next phase of my career now.

I am not sure how to transition from being a coder founder executive to Director or VP level executive.

Any other founder who went through something similar?
stories.title: Ask HN: What's After Acquisition for a Founder?
